org.fluidity.composition.spi

Interface PackageBindings

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentContainer.Bindings
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmptyPackageBindings

    @ServiceProvider(api=PackageBindings.class,
                 type="bindings")
public interface PackageBindings
extends ComponentContainer.Bindings
    An implementation of this interface is placed, either automatically by the org.fluidity.maven:composition-maven-plugin Maven plugin or manually by the component developer, in each package that contains component implementations. The goal of these classes is to add, to the supplied registry, component bindings for component implementations in the respective package. The components thus bound may depend on other components in the container and vice versa.

    Placing the implementation of this interface in the same package as the components it binds allows those component classes to be package protected and thus makes it possible to hide them from view to prevent careless use.

    Usage

    See EmptyPackageBindings.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String SERVICE_TYPE
      Distinguishes package bindings from ordinary service providers.

        bindComponents

    • Field Detail

      • SERVICE_TYPE

        static final String SERVICE_TYPE
        Distinguishes package bindings from ordinary service providers.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(OpenContainer container,
                ContainerTermination shutdown)
         throws Exception
        Perform package initialization if necessary. This method is invoked once after the ComponentContainer.Bindings.bindComponents() method of all PackageBindings objects have been invoked and before any component is externally accessed in the provided container.
        Parameters:
        container - the container that was populated by the ComponentContainer.Bindings.bindComponents(org.fluidity.composition.ComponentContainer.Registry) method.
        shutdown - allows registration of actions to be performed when the container shuts down.
        Throws:
        Exception - when an error occurs.
